column2: juanteen, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: used in stress test, caused pain in head, chest, stomach, bowels, cold sweats and neausea.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had this medication four times in the last year and 1/2 all with great success after one dose. One of the times took about 60 seconds to bring my heart rate down. Then there was an awful pressure that lasted about 3 minutes and I had a hard time to catch my breathe. The other three times took less than 20 seconds for my heart rate to return to a normal state and the pressure and shortness of breathe lasted about 90 seconds. I have a love/hate relationship with this drug. Love how it works but hate the feeling that goes with it. If need be I will gladly use this drug again until I have an ablation done.

column1: Having a Rapid Heart Action - Supraventricular Tachycardia
column2: angel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Heart started racing out of nowhere? Husband took me to the ER. BPM's were over 200. And, I am 29 weeks pregnant. When they gave me the Adenosine in my IV, it was a matter of seconds. You felt a funny feeling through your body for about 15 seconds. Other than that, it definitely worked for me!!

column1: Having a Rapid Heart Action - Supraventricular Tachycardia
column9: I received this drug IV in an ER dept when I noted to have a very high, pounding heartrate. My pulse when I got to the ER dept was 158bpm and it was causing me to have chest pressure, dizziness, and short of breath. I had never experienced this before and I am a healthy 30 year old female. When the vasovagal maneuvers didn't work they had to give me 3 doses of Adensoine and it gave me the worst chest pain/tightness, and I felt like I couldn't breathe. Unfortunately, it only dropped my heartrate to 80bpm for only 2 minutes and it shot back up again. I had to have cardioversion and that was also unpleasant but I was asleep and don't really remember it all. I still haven't found out why my heartrate was so high and I certainly hope I never have to experience it again.

column1: Having a Rapid Heart Action - Supraventricular Tachycardia
column2: bzmomof2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I received this drug via IV in the ER. Heart was 160 beats per minute. Worked very quickly less than 10 seconds rhythm fell to 100 bpm. It felt as if I was in an elevator going down fast. I did not have any reactions afterwards.

column1: Having a Rapid Heart Action - Supraventricular Tachycardia
column2: God's Child, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Periodically, my heart starts racing, and I cannot get it to quiet down by the usual methods:slow, deep breathing, etc. A trip to the ER, and an IV of adenosine works beautifully and quickly to restore normal sinus rhythm.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had rapid heartbeats for 38 years. IT WORKS when my normal meds do not.

column1: Having a Rapid Heart Action - Supraventricular Tachycardia
column9: I was at work my heart started racing, my partner took me to the ER, my pulse was 198-210 & rising. They gave me Adenosinein my IV and in less than 10 seconds I was back to normal.

column2: Adenosine Nuclear Stress Test, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to havea Adenosine Nuclear Stress Test for part of a pre admission testing for back surgery, even though I have no history or family history of heart problems. As soon as the drug was injected I felt as though fire was running through my veins, I felt as though I was about to die, then my head started trobbing, my left ear felt like it was bleeding & was so naseus & thought for sure I'd throw up but then stopped the injection early as they stated they had what they needed for the test.I plan on contacting my family doctor today & I'll wil never take this test again.
